about.description: Sometimes quick experiments in IPython grow large and you find yourself wanting unit tests. This module aims to make testing code in IPython notebooks easy. At its core, it offers a way to run pytest tests inside the notebook environment. It is also designed to make the transfer of the tests into proper python modules easy.

name: ipytest

new_version_errors.0.8.0:
The recipe did not change in the version migration, a URL did not hash, or there is jinja2 syntax the bot cannot handle!

Please check the URLs in your recipe with version '0.8.0' to make sure they exist!

We also found the following errors:

 - could not hash URL template 'https://pypi.io/packages/{{ arch }}/{{ name[0] }}/{{ name }}/{{ fn }}'

raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "ipytest" %}
{% set version = "0.8.1" %}


package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://pypi.io/packages/source/{{ name[0] }}/{{ name }}/{{ name }}-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 8e42fafbad433c418731dca833f0a165d581af0f376721ba7c0107b782d919e7

build:
  number: 0
  noarch: python
  script: {{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . -vv

requirements:
  host:
    - pip
    - python >=3.0
  run:
    - packaging
    - python >=3.0

test:
  imports:
    - ipytest
  commands:
    - pip check
  requires:
    - pip

about:
  home: https://pypi.org/project/ipytest/
  summary: Unit tests in IPython notebooks.
  description: |
    Sometimes quick experiments in IPython grow large and you find yourself wanting unit tests. This module aims to make testing code in IPython notebooks easy. At its core, it offers a way to run pytest tests inside the notebook environment. It is also designed to make the transfer of the tests into proper python modules easy.
  license: MIT
  license_file: LICENSE.md

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - xhochy
    - pmgrafe
smithy_version:
No azure token. Create a token and
put it in ~/.conda-smithy/azure.token
3.6.16
